other_tests.findings: Cytologic examination of the bronchoalveolar-lavage (BAL) fluid revealed round, double-contoured, thick-walled, endospore-filled spherules, findings that were morphologically consistent with C. immitis or C. posadasii.
Uri -nnalysis revealed 3+ blood and 2+ protein, and microscopic examination of the sediment revealed 10 to 20 red cells per high-power field, including acanthocytes.
Cytomegalovirus DNA was detected in the blood (4680 international units [IU] per milliliter).
